utils

Class FindXSS

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.FindXSS

  • public class FindXSS
extends java.lang.Object
    Class is responsible for finding valid XSS and CSRF attacks in user submissions

    This file is part of the Security Shepherd Project. The Security Shepherd project is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

    • Field Detail

      • javascriptTriggers

        public static java.lang.String[] javascriptTriggers
        Method used to detect valid java script in a user submission. Specifically the presence of a script that will execute an alert command. Script tag, URI java script and java script triggers vectors are all including in this detection method.

      • uriAttributes

        public static java.lang.String[] uriAttributes

        public static java.lang.String[] colons

      • findCsrf

        public static boolean findCsrf(java.lang.String messageForAdmin,
               java.lang.String falseId)
        Method used to validate GET request CSRF attacks embeded in IMG tags.
        Parameters:
        messageForAdmin -
        falseId -
        Returns:

      • findCsrfAttackUrl

        public static boolean findCsrfAttackUrl(java.lang.String theUrl,
                        java.lang.String csrfAttackPath)
        Searches for URL that contains CSRF attack string without user ID expected. Returns true if it is valid based on parameters submitted
        Parameters:
        theUrl - The Entire URL containing the attack
        csrfAttackPath - The path the CSRF vulnerable function should be in
        Returns:
        boolean value depicting if the attack is valid or not

      • findCsrfAttackUrl

        public static boolean findCsrfAttackUrl(java.lang.String theUrl,
                        java.lang.String csrfAttackPath,
                        java.lang.String userIdParameterName,
                        java.lang.String userIdParameterValue)
        Searches for URL that contains CSRF attack string. Returns true if it is valid based on parameters submitted
        Parameters:
        theUrl - The Entire URL containing the attack
        csrfAttackPath - The path the CSRF vulnerable function should be in
        userIdParameterName - The user ID parameter name expected
        userIdParameterValue - The user ID parameter value expected
        Returns:
        boolean value depicting if the attack is valid or not

      • search

        public static boolean search(java.lang.String xssString)
        Forms XSS Input for XHTML before Searching with Shepherd XSS Detector
        Parameters:
        xssString - Untrusted User Input
        Returns:
        Boolean value depicting if XSS was detected
